com.versant.trans
Class Query

java.lang.Object
  com.versant.fund.AbstractQuery
      com.versant.trans.Query

public class Query
extends AbstractQuery

The Query class defines a query in a single database. The database and query string are set in the constructor. Queries will always take the form

Select selfoid from classname

Additional options like lock modes can be set after the constructor is completed.

Before the query can be executed, all parameters defined in the query string need to be bound with the Query.bind() method. Query.execute() returns a QueryResult.

Since:
7.0
See Also:
QueryResult

database - - The database to which the query will be send.

Method Detail

finalize

public void finalize()
Overrides:
finalize in class AbstractQuery

close

public void close()
Query.close() should be called once the query is not needed anymore to free internal resources. Calling this method will also close all QueryResult instances created by this Query through Query.execute().

This method can safely be called twice. It will also be called by finalize().

setClassLockMode

public Query setClassLockMode(int mode)
Sets the class lock mode for this query. The default class lock mode is Constants.IRLOCK.

Possible lock modes

com.versant.fund.Constants.NOLOCK com.versant.fund.Constants.IRLOCK com.versant.fund.Constants.IWLOCK com.versant.fund.Constants.RLOCK com.versant.fund.Constants.ULOCK com.versant.fund.Constants.WLOCK

Parameters:
mode - - the lock mode
Returns:
The Query instance

setFetchSize

public Query setFetchSize(int size)
Sets a hint for the number of objects to be retrieved on the database server site in each batch. Default is -1. All non-positive values of size mean that the complete result set is calculated on the server side when calling one of the execute methods.

Positive values allow query execution in multiple steps (cursor batches). In this case, the query execution in the database is continued transparently, when the objects of a batch have been consumed during iteration over the query result on the client site.

While iterating over the result set the objects are fetched into the client object cache one by one, by default. Use the QueryExecutionOption fetchObjects to fetch the next batch of objects into the object cache in one single group operation.

Parameters:
size - - the number of objects to be retrieved in each execution step
Returns:
this Query instance
See Also:
Query.execute(QueryExecutionOptions), Query.setQueryExecutionOptions(QueryExecutionOptions), QueryExecutionOptions.setFetchObjects(boolean)

Gets the fetch size currently used by this query.

setCandidateCollection

public Query setCandidateCollection(java.lang.String candidate,
                                    java.lang.Object[] collection)
This method defines a candidate collection for the query. When a candidate collection is set, the query will only consider objects in the collection and not the whole class extent.

The candidate name is the class name as defined in the query string.

Parameters:
candidate - The name of the candidate, currently the class name as defined in the query string.
collection - The collection of objects over which the query is executed.
Returns:
The Query instance.

getCandidateCollection

public java.lang.Object[] getCandidateCollection(java.lang.String candidate)
This method returns the candidate collection set in Query.setCandidateCollection()

Parameters:
candidate - The name of the candidate, currently the class name as defined in the query string.
Returns:
An array of objects that make up the candidate collection.
See Also:
Query.setCandidateCollection(String candidate, Object[] collection)

bind

public Query bind(java.lang.String parameter,
                  java.lang.Object value)
This method will bind a parameter specified in the query string to a value. The method has to be called for every parameters defined in the query before it can be executed, otherwise an exception will be thrown.

Parameters in a query are defined as $<name>. The parameter name used in this call is the name without the $ sign.

Parameters:
parameter - - The name of the parameter
value - - The value to which the parameter should be bound
Returns:
The query instance.

execute

public QueryResult execute()
Executes the query in the database and returns a QueryResult. The QueryExecutionOptions defined in Query.setQueryExecutionOptions() or the default options are used.

Returns:
The QueryResult instance
See Also:
Query.setQueryExecutionOptions(QueryExecutionOptions options)

execute

public QueryResult execute(QueryExecutionOptions options)
Executes the query in the database and returns a QueryResult.

The options passed as a parameter are used instead of the internal options. This method will not change the internal options.

Parameters:
options - - QueryExecutionOptions to be used for this execution
Returns:
result - a QueryResult instance
